Music Theory

Here's a list of elements of basic music theory with a brief description of each!

Time Signature

A numerical symbol that indicates the number of beats in a measure and which note receives the beat.

Dynamics

The variations in volume or intensity of a musical performance, adding expressiveness and emotion.

Tempo

Tempo is the speed or pace of a musical piece, measured in beats per minute (BPM).

Musical Notation

The system of written symbols used to represent musical sounds, including notes, rests, and other markings.

Intervals

The distance between two pitches, determining their relationship and creating tension or consonance.

Cadences

A sequence of chords or notes that create a sense of resolution or finality at the end of a musical phrase.
